name: R-Project.org
tooltip: Home of the R Project. Includes documentation and resources for R.

name: RStudio
tooltip: The IDE that most R-programmers use. Its website has documentation & tutorials on various R-packages developed by RStudio.

name: CRAN
tooltip: Comprehensive R Archive Network: The primary database of popular R libraries and documentation.

name: Bioconductor
tooltip: A very popular database for R libraries related to genomics.

name: RDocumentation
tooltip: Searching R packages can be difficult. RDocumentation pools libraries from CRAN + Bioconductor + Github for search. Libraries are broken into task views (i.e. categories related to task). Users can search by measures such as download frequency.

name: Shiny
tooltip: A tool for building interactive R web applications. Its website includes Documentation + Webinars + Tutorials + Articles.

name: RMarkdown
tooltip: Language for combining R with Markdown for incorporating R into reproducible reports and websites. Its website includes documentation and examples.

name: knitr
tooltip: Expands on RMarkdown for dynamic and reproducible report generation in RStudio. Its website includes documentation and tutorials.

name: ggplot2
tooltip: The most popular graphing library in R. Its website includes documentation and examples.

name: caret
tooltip: A wrapper for machine learning libraries that makes modeling consistent and easy. Its website includes documentation and tutorials.

name: Intro to Statistical Learning (ISL)
tooltip: A free book on many of the most popular statistics and machine learning tools with applications in R.

name: Elements of Statistical Learning (ESL)
tooltip: A free book that goes much more in-depth than ISL.

name: R for Data Science
tooltip: A free online book that covers data wrangling and visualization with libraries such as dplyr + tidyr + ggplot2.

name: Advanced R
tooltip: A free online book for R-programmers that want to improve their programming skills and understanding of the language.

name: R Packages
tooltip: A free online book for R-programmers that want to develop R packages for reproducibility and so others can use.

name: Forecasting: Principles & Practice
tooltip: Free online book that covers forecasting in R.

name: Little Book of R for Time Series
tooltip: Free online resource that walks users through the essentials of forecasting in R.

name: Great Libraries for Working w/ Data
tooltip: Computerworld's best R packages for data import + wrangling + visualization.

name: 60+ R Resources
tooltip: Computerworld's list of best R resources.

name: RDataMining.com
tooltip: A nice resource on data mining with training + documents + examples.

name: R-Bloggers
tooltip: An R blog aggregator combining blogs from many advanced R users.
